<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #17972 (tests: Add fuzzing harness for CKey and key related functions by practicalswift)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
<!--cf906140f33d8803c4a75a2196329ecb-->Needs rebase
Rebased! :)
Can test a roundtrip of `FormatMoney<->ParseMoney`?
Can test a roundtrip of `ValueFromAmount.getValStr<->ParseMoney`?
<!--cf906140f33d8803c4a75a2196329ecb-->Needs rebase
Very good idea! Thanks for the suggestion. Now added :)
Another very good idea! Thanks! Now added :)
Fixed!
Fixed!
@MarcoFalke Thanks for great feedback. All feedback addressed. Please re-review :)

```
core_write.cpp:21:29: runtime error: negation of -9223372036854775808 cannot be represented in type 'CAmount' (aka 'long'); cast to an unsigned type to negate this value to itself

    #0 0x5603b409bffb in ValueFromAmount(long const&) /home/travis/build/bitcoin/bitcoin/build/bitcoin-x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/src/core_write.cpp:21:29

    #1 0x5603b40a7304 in TxToUniv(CTransaction const&, uint256 const&, UniValue&, bool, int) /home/travis/build/bitcoin/bitcoin/build/bitcoin-x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/src/core_write.cpp:220:29

    #2 0x5603b3fcb99e in test_one_input(std::vector<unsigned char, std::allocator<unsigned char> > const&) /home/travis/build/bitcoin/bitcoin/build/bitcoin-x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/src/test/fuzz/transaction.cpp:102:5

    #3 0x5603b3fbf42a in LLVMFuzzerTestOneInput /home/travis/build/bitcoin/bitcoin/build/bitcoin-x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/src/test/fuzz/fuzz.cpp:38:5

    #4 0x5603b3ec510a in fuzzer::Fuzzer::ExecuteCallback(unsigned char const*, unsigned long) (/home/travis/build/bitcoin/bitcoin/build/bitcoin-x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/src/test/fuzz/transaction+0x1f5510a)

    #5 0x5603b3ec4905 in fuzzer::Fuzzer::RunOne(unsigned char const*, unsigned long, bool, fuzzer::InputInfo*, bool*) (/home/travis/build/bitcoin/bitcoin/build/bitcoin-x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/src/test/fuzz/transaction+0x1f54905)

    #6 0x5603b3ec73ce in fuzzer::Fuzzer::ReadAndExecuteSeedCorpora(std::vector<std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >, fuzzer::fuzzer_allocator<std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> > > > const&) (/home/travis/build/bitcoin/bitcoin/build/bitcoin-x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/src/test/fuzz/transaction+0x1f573ce)

    #7 0x5603b3ec7965 in fuzzer::Fuzzer::Loop(std::vector<std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >, fuzzer::fuzzer_allocator<std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> > > > const&) (/home/travis/build/bitcoin/bitcoin/build/bitcoin-x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/src/test/fuzz/transaction+0x1f57965)

    #8 0x5603b3eba420 in fuzzer::FuzzerDriver(int*, char***, int (*)(unsigned char const*, unsigned long)) (/home/travis/build/bitcoin/bitcoin/build/bitcoin-x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/src/test/fuzz/transaction+0x1f4a420)

    #9 0x5603b3ee1342 in main (/home/travis/build/bitcoin/bitcoin/build/bitcoin-x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/src/test/fuzz/transaction+0x1f71342)

    #10 0x7ff8c3d4cb96 in __libc_start_main (/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6+0x21b96)

    #11 0x5603b3eb2e29 in _start (/home/travis/build/bitcoin/bitcoin/build/bitcoin-x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/src/test/fuzz/transaction+0x1f42e29)
Thanks. Now fixed. Happened to rebase on `master` too -- blaming muscle memory :)
Could also assert the roundtrip `decompressed == script`?
Looks like you accidentally added a unit test here? This does not depend on any fuzz input.
@MarcoFalke Are you sure about that? `vch` is built from `buffer` which is built from fuzz input, no? :)

I'm afraid not since that assertion is not guaranteed to hold :)

Counter-example:

```
$ xxd -p -r <<< "210220acacacffff6010b472a266d0bd89c13706a4132ccfb16f7c3b9fcbacacacacac" > counter-example
$ src/test/fuzz/script counter-example

script: test/fuzz/script.cpp:40: void test_one_input(const std::vector<uint8_t> &): Assertion `script == decompressed_script' failed.

```
I am pretty sure that if it was not guaranteed to hold, we would be running into consensus failures pretty soon. Please take a look at #18292

`buffer` is only *appened* to `vch`, but pratically never read. Only the beginning of `vch` (20 or 32 bytes) are read, and they are all constant (zero). So this does never read any fuzz input, except for copying into the vector.

I suggest to remove this for loop and content.
With #18292 it all makes sense. Thanks!
ping @practicalswift
I'll fix. Thanks for the ping :)
